title: Hostel at best
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Perfect location
review: What a crap establishment! We are a family of 2 teenage boys so at least they put us on the same floor. However... shower didn't work so really enjoyed the cup shower. Rooms NEVER got cleaned and we stayed 3 days. Stairs are gine if you have small feet but would be a health and safety issue in my country. Both rooms TVs had cracks on the screen so some of the screen you couldn't see. And yes, like other posts the tiny bathroom does smell bad.  Breakfast was so-so. The cooked food was soaked in oil but they did have bread and fruit so you will find something to eat.  Honestly... go to the hotel next door. Same location but nicer! This was crap!

title: Absolute garbage
review: The location is perfect. Rooms are quite and clean. The staff is polite. The breakfast was included in the price- the restaurant has a beautiful terrace with a wonderful view of the Bosphorus. Recommend it .

title: Horrible
review: This hotel is the worse hotel you can visit. The furniture is moldy, shower does not work, every day they claim to fix it but it never worked, insulation was horrible, you can hear everything on the other rooms and the street, the rooms are crazy small and nothing like the pictures, they do not provide any facilities, when we asked for a kettle 3 times they gave us a dirty one, the pillows were damaged and when we asked for new ones they ignored us, they overcharged us, and cancelled our reservation on booking so we are not able to review them. All the reviews on booking.com are fake. Staff are very rude and disrespectful, one of them threw our luggage out of the taxi and started screaming at us. You are litterally better off staying on the street than at this horrible place. We reported them to the police and are filling a lawsuit against them with many videos to prove our case.…

title: Beyond terrible
review: We had 4 rooms and all of the rooms had mold on the wall and the rooms were not clean at all. We found hairs on the floor and also in shower. Besides that, the bathroom tiles were dirty with blood. In addition, we couldn’t sleep very well becouse the rooms were very noisy and we heard everything, including the phone alarm from another room. In the end, we don’t recommend this hotel and we wouldn’t return here.

title: Bad experience
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Average
review: With regret I'm writing this review for the worst hotel I have ever visitid in my life, let me tell you in details what happened and how they were performing, before arriving I sent them emails to validate that the amount has been recived by thier side, and they never reply except sending to Hotels.com and then they replyed, I booked a family room and asked them to be with one duble bed and 2 single beds, they didn't reply to my mail, and when we arrived they told us that they have only one famlily room and it's now already booked by other guests so they have other options, to give us one 3 beds room (and free transportation to the airport) or 2 double rooms, I told him that I booked family room they said that now it's not free and I gave you other options.. we acepted 2…

title: Bad quality but great location
review: Staff are super friendly and they offer help everytime they see you. Reception staff are amazing. Hotel location is perfect. But the rooms are not good, they are old and small.  What made me give 4 stars are the staff.

title: Amazing location
review: Pros: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Close to the major attractions and transport hubs. The staff is friendly and helpful and the breakfast was ok.  Cons: The hotel seems recently renovated but the quality is really low. The rooms are quite small. I had to change my room because it was in a really bad condition - mold in the bathroom, brown spots on the bedding and towels, broken parts, almost no light. The receptionist made me pay before even see the room! The second room was a bit better but I had to jump over the toilet to get in and out of the bathroom. I saw clean towels left on the stairs while the cleaning lady was changing the sheets in one of the rooms on the same floor. Plus, there is no elevator on the ground floor. You need to take the steep…

title: Good experience
review: hello I stayed Grand Hurriyet Hotel last year in august, It was good and comfortable for me. location is best, everything is near to hotel sightseeings, cafes, restaurants, shops, tramway, Marmaray Sirkeci Station.  i visited most of sightseeings by walk, because hotel locations is very convenient. staff is very friendly and helpful. rooms are small, but clear and comfortable for me. breakfast is very good. if i'll go in Istanbul (i know i will be back) i stay again in hurriyet hotel.  thanks

title: Amazing location and service
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice country
review: I spent 5 days in Istanbul at Grand Hurriyet Hotel and was amazed at how beautiful the service was. Location was just perfect and the room was spacious and very comfortable. I was within walking distance to the main shopping district, places of interest and public transport. From the moment i checked in until i checked out i was well looked after and treated like family. Mohammed (the owner) ensured i was comfortable and safe throughout my stay and the place felt like a home away from home! Highly recommended!

title: Good hotel, even better location and really the best price
review: This is my first time to turkey I like this country too much and people very friendly for hotel I liked because very nice location and very security blue mosque hagia sophia just ten minuet by walking and room is very clean I like this hotel if I come again i will come here

title: Very nice
review: The hotel is really in a great location, with a walking distance to the famous Hagia Sophia , the Blue mosque, Topkapi palace, Galata bridge and many other historical sights of the old town. The hotel is perfectly renovated and equipped, has all that is necessary: free wi-fi, air conditioning, satellite TV and decent bathroom. The restaurant is on the top of the building with a beautiful view of Istanbul, Golden Horn and Bosphorus and with excellent menu offer. What is particularly amazing, it's very helpful staff and a very good price for all this. I can not wait to come here again!

title: Best place
review: The hotel is very nice, clean. The staff is very kind, friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and served in the terrace with a beautiful view over the bessfur.. The location is excellent. Very close to bus, tram and ferry stations. You can reach most of the important placed by walking..

title: Good for it's price
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Never again!
review: If you are a big family,it is not the best place to stay unless you split by rooms on the same floor.The rooms are really tiny,but it is Istanbul Old Town,so unless it's 5 * don't expect to get big space.It is clean enough,but everything is old.There was a problem with AC in two rooms we rented,one window wasn't closing so take care if you have children.The breakfast was veeery average,for two days there were not any cornflakes,one day coffee was not available.The view of terrace was beautiful.There was only 1 kettle for 3 rooms and iron was not available anyways.I realised,that whatever they write on booking will not be 100% from what to expect.The staff was trying to be friendly,but it seems that for many in Turkey is hard to keep the attitude away.But location and price are…

title: Lovely family hotel
review: The room is tiny, it smells very bad, it's old and not clean. But what matters most is that the staff is very rude and unacceptably impolite.  Not recommended at all. Very surprised of all the positive comments this place has cause it doesn't deserve any of them!

title: Very good located hotel, friendly stuff.
review: Really nice hotel with wonderful staff.Yes, rooms are small but clean and great for the price you pay.All the tourist sites are within walking distant and the breakfast served looking out to the sea is good.suppose to be updating the hotel hope they have done this for our next visit which is just around the corner.Can't really fault the hotel felt very safe and staff at all times try their best to help.Don't be put off with the other reviews if u want luxury pay for a slightly higher grade hotel otherwise this does the job.

title: Very bad experience
review: The hotel is very good located, at the historical center, just behind Marmaray metro line station, very close to ferry and tramway stations. Very comfortable fr the travellers who likes to combine business and sightseeing. The hotel isn't expensive, so, you shld not expect 5 stars services, but rooms are clean enough, probabaly just some refurnishing is necessary. Breakfast served at the roof restaurant with the view to Bosporus.

title: Again in Hurriyet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: The bad experience
review: This is second time I have visited Istanbul and Hurriyet hotel. It has great location, very clean hotel with a friendly stuff. Tram station is few minut away, but u can easy walk to Blue mosque, Topkapi or Grand Bazar. Hotel stuff helped us with advices so we pretty saved money on public transport with Istanbul card. Rooms r bigger on right side but still I didnt spent so much time in the room so it wasnt important for me. Quality of sleep is good as a breakfast too. It has great value for the money u paied, so I truly reccomend Hurriyet.

title: Good for me
review: Thanks for your kind comment and taking time for rating us, hosting you is our pleasure, hope to meet you again in your next trip to istanbul. Regards

title: Ideal location but not a great hotel
review: I have been in Istanbul 5 times but is was the worse hotel which I ever booked. The room is so small that I can not put my luggage and go in the room. The linen and towels are dirty, grey colour and very  very old. I could not use it and bought new towels. The bathroom is small too. Room is needed to repair. Thera was terrace under my room. Staff serviced tables in the night and it was difficult to sleep. Iy was good that I stayed there only 2 nights and came to the hotel in the night. There is just one good moment- location.

title: Great!
review: It was good and comfortable stay , breakfast was good and view from the roof in the morning  Frindly team and helpfull Suitable for family Near from the metro station and many events there They offer transporting to the air port

title: I will be back
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Tranquil oasis
review: Perfect location - near the tram station, ferry and historical centre, very kind and helpful staff, amasing view during the breakfast...I will definatelly choose this hotel once again for my next trip to Istanbul .

title: Excellent Choice for Solo/Double Travellers
review: Thank you very much for your kind comment. It was a pleasure to have you here.We hope  to  see you again.

title: Hurriyet hotel
review: Hidden in a back street behind the Sirkeci railway station this hotel is ideal for tourists. All the major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance. Breakfast on the roof terrace is very good with a wonderful selection fresh every day. Rooms and common areas very clean and the staff are very attentive and pleasant. No noise ensuring a good nights sleep. Slight down side with the lift starting on the first floor but the staff will carry your bags. Not so good for the less abled visitor. Electrical installation leaves a lot to be desired but no worse than others I have been in. Bargain prices and an ideal location.

title: Bad night in bad hotel !
review: Stayed to this hotel twice. Last July 2014 and May 2015. I love and recommend this hotel for 5 reason. (1) Location - Near to Tram station, Ferry Port, Train station (Serkeci) only a Minute walk. and Shops & Fast food / Resto. (2) Breakfast - served at 4th floor with a good view of the sea. (3) Because of the Tram station & Ferry Port, you can visit the Key Tourist Locations in Istanbul, Princess Islands and Bursa and a 10 minute walk from Basilica Cistern and SultanHamet. (4) Security and Friendly Staff and (5) Cleanliness. Things to consider (1) The room is Small, Bathroom and Shower are small area also, (2) the stairs are narrow and spiral type. That is why it is good for Solo (like me) or Two person in one room.

title: Shabby and run-down
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Too many bad things so we left
review: We were unlucky enough to stay in the older part of the hotel, but lucky enough not to get a room with sewage smell, as did others. Nevertheless, the room was small, the bath tiny, and both in dire need of refurbishment, as were several pieces of furniture. There was a phone installed in the bathroom, I guess as compensation for the TV which did not work. The breakfast is basic, but ok. The only good thing was the location, which is really central - but so are many other hotels. I will not go back to this one, for sure.

title: Comfortable, clean, convenient
review: We picked this hotel for its location near main sights and the oceanfront but that's about all they have to offer. It's on a dark side street. The room was basic but run-down and the thin carpeting was dirty. The bathroom was so small you couldn't open the door completely without being stopped by the sink. The shower doors didn't slide on the tracks and had to be forced open. Towels were worn and small. To reach the tiny elevator you had to walk upstairs to the first floor and then climb four more steps to reach the call button and pull open the outside lift door which was not automatic. Breakfast was basic and it seemed they'd run out of things but showed no intention of refilling the trays even though serving time was posted to last another hour.  It was served on a terrace…

title: Very basic hotel, but centric
review: Mehmet and his staff are warm and welcoming.  The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable,  furnishings updated.Some guests complain that the bathrooms are small.  Small baths are common in Europe and around the world (other than U.S.A. !).  I had no problem adapting.  The location is excellent -- a couple of blocks from Sirkeci tram station,  very close to major attractions, a short walk to Eminonu ferries, Galata Bridge, and Spice Bazaar.  I stayed twice at Hurriyet.  It's my Istanbul home.  Also I am a woman (60-something)  traveling alone and feel perfectly comfortable with the hotel and the location.

title: Ideal Location
review: We spent 2 nights in this hotel. The overall quality is not spectacular, anyway it is located at 15 mins walkink to Santa Sophia. Very close to the sea as well. Bathroom in poor conditions. I appreciated the view from the terrace were we got the breakfast, very poor I would say. The attention of the personnel was very good though.

title: I don't recommend this hotel very disgusting HOTEL
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Total crap. Avoid if you can!
review: I stayed this hotel one day I prefferd one french bed and comfort room but they gave me standart room with three seperatly beds also regular check out time was at 12.00 on the afternoon while I was sleeping at 11.30 one of the person tried open the door and knocked door when I complained this to morning reception clerk he talked with me very rude and he said that Why are you talking about this ? Ok this is fault but brother don't talk that's enough shut up.He talked with me as a forest bear.I'm not brother to anyone.If you are selling this room with €55 per night you should be proffesional,Also breakfast is not rich it was so poor.  Finally,I don't recommend this Hotel to anyone you are not taking your service with your money. DON'T GO TO HURRIYET HOTEL !!!

title: Nice Rooftop breakfas, Nice location
review: We had booked a family room for 4, they couldn't find our reservation. So we ended up in 2 separate tiny rooms. The floor wasn't mopped, there were footprints and hair. The pillows are ancient and probably carry ancient bugs in them.   The tiny bathroom wasn't clean, the toilet wasn't clean, even though it had a sanitized wrap around. When I approached the concierge, he just shrugged me off and informed me that the cleaning ladies had left already and tomorrow, tomorrow.   I am so disgusted and dissatisfied. This is not my first trip to Istanbul, there are nicer places!

title: Avoid if at all possible
review: The location is very good, walking distance to most of the tourist attraction in istanbul like Bosphorus and golden horn river, mosque and to the grand bazzar. 5 minutes walk to serkesi train station. I like the mini buffet, great selection of my favorite breakfast food on the rooftop of the hotel with the view of the river and the unbelievable parking lot downstair.the room is clean, toilet is small. Good for solo or two cowboy traveller.

title: good place
review: Spent two nights at this hotel recently on my first visit to Istanbul. Choose it simply for its location and to be fair it is close to some of the main sightseeing points but in terms of accommodation it was terrible.   From start to finish the staff was horrible to deal with, maybe this had something to do with me being a female travelling alone but I have a feeling this is how they are in general. It took several emails before I could book a pick up from the airport to the hotel, which they were charging €25 for. As I was getting in close to midnight and did not know the city I felt this was the fastest and safest option. I waiting at the arrivals for 15mins with my bags walking up and down in search of a sign with my name on it but eventually another driver asked me if I need…

title: You get what you pay for?
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: The people make this place good
review: Our first stop on a European budget tour, so the price suited us, although the room was VERY small, & not a bit like the picture that we'd seen! next morning we went to the breakfast room & discovered the other side of the B&B was much better!! as we were staying 4 nights we asked to change rooms, & they were very helpful & pleasant about it, giving us a room on the other side, which was much better. The breakfast was plentiful & staff friendly, as I say, you get what you pay for & we were happy with our new room, situation is great for all attractions in the old town, & most places within walking distance. would stay there again, just don't expect luxury! on our departure I was presented with a necklace by the managers, which I thought was a nice gesture.

title: All the reviews are True - its 2 hotels in one, so buyer beware!
review: If you're looking for fancy luxury accommodations, this obviously isn't the place. But it's situated in a nice part of Istanbul near the Bosphorus, and also close to nearly all forms of public transit.   Rooms were small but clean. Breakfast every morning on the top floor was delicious and lovely. We loved the people working there the most, as they were all so friendly and chatty, and extremely helpful whenever we needed any advice on navigating the city, or wanted random items, i.e. nail clipper, scissors, or hair dryer.   Before leaving, the manager even provided us with small Istanbul key-chains as souvenirs. Of course it's not an expensive gift, but the gesture and thoughtfulness were very moving. We've traveled quite a bit abroad, and stayed at many wonderful places, but…

title: Very pleased
review: I spent a lot of time looking at hotels in Istanbul before i made my trip and now that i have returned, i can say flatly "you're better off avoiding the hurriyet hotel".  Here's how it went for me, I had seen all the reviews that point out the dual-nature of this hotel (and they're correct -- its actually two separate buildings with two separate access staircases.  They knocked through the wall at the ground level to create the lobby, but beyond that they are two different places.)  For price & location, i had been considering the hurriyet hotel, but was afraid to book through a website because there would be no guarantee as to which part of the hotel you would end up in.  So, i thought i would be smart, i emailed the hotel directly to make my booking.  They made the booking…

title: Clean
review: Hotel stuff was very friendly. The location was very good, all main sights at walking distance. The rooms were nice clean and comfortable. Nice terrace with beautiful view over Bosporus and Golden horn, good breakfast.  All what we needed.

title: Only a bed for the night.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very clean and friendly
review: Stayed 1 night back in 2012. Small room - bed took up nearly the complete room. Had to climb over partner to get into bed. No elevator - had to cart our heavy luggage up stairs. They did arrange fast inexpensive shuttle bus to airport though.

title: Nice Hotel
review: This hotel was very clean and accommodating.  The hotel has been newly renovated and is very tastefully done. The rooms are very small but clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and polite. The breakfast is served on the top floor with a patio that overlooks the city. This is a free breakfast buffet, continental style and very well presented. All in all very good value for the money. It is nicely located, walking distance to wonderful sites and the grand bazaar. The metro is close to take you to other areas of the city.  We loved this hotel and where it was located!

title: Near the Topkapi Palace and the historic sites
review: I stay in Hurriyet for 4 nigths and i find is a nice Hote,rooms are verry small and clean but for one person whas ok.Bathroom is small aswell and no seperate shower place.Breakfast is on the last floor with terrace verry nice for smoker.For breakfast they have enougth choice and nice Börek only negatif point i always should whait long time to get bread whas not so funny. The guy at the reception whas verry nice and helpfully. Lokcation is verry good near Sirkeci station and 2 min from Gulhane Tram station. Big plus also i got smoking room.

title: DON'T GO
review: In the old part of town is the Hotel that is close to most of the sights.   The rooms are clean and simple. The price is very affordable and convenient.    The staff is friendly.The hotel is not responsible for metron station being built near the hotel. .Breakfast is good. A true city hotel.

title: Visitor friendly accommodation
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Deception...
review: I arrived at this hotel about 8am one morning after arriving in Istanbul on an overnight bus. Obviously it was too early to check in but they still offered me breakfast, which I gladly accepted! The view of the harbour from the restaurant is spectacular! Many of the hosts speak reasonable English and they were helpful in directing me towards the best places for Turkish dinner and baklava. The location is superb! Approx 10min walk to the heart of Sultanahment and 10min to the ferry port...definitely within walking distance of a number of the main attractions. I was in a single room, it was small but very clean and tidy. I was on a tight budget but still wanted somewhere pleasant to stay after a week in rural turkey in "holes and the wall" and overnight buses. At 50 euro for a…

title: Recomandation
review: This hotel has two parts.The good one that was on the photos in booking.com and the bad bad part, that you should live on... with not hot water,no tv,no elevetor...after a big squabble they gave us another room, much better with tv, jacuzzi and view...  the best thing was the location! you could walk everywhere in the old town of Istanbul!!!

title: nice place, near to all famous sites
review: I was staying in this hotel for 3 days in January. It is warm, clean and cozy place. The staff is extremaly nice and helpful. The location is perfect, close to the most famous places in Old Town. Brekfast is ok. I would always stay here while being in Istambul. The prize is very resonable, too.

title: Very good location
review: Hotel is clean, staff very friendly but room too small. I had to climb over my bed to open the window. Desk in room could not be used due to lack of space. Heating was working only a few hours per day. Door of bathroom could not be opened completely due to lack of space. Breakfast was very good with view to the Bosporus. After all I was satisfied with the hotel but next time I will ask for a better room (they have some rooms with more space)

title: No way
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: What a gem!!!
review: Was one of the worst choices,room was small,water comes out of the shower,no good view from the window(all I could see is just old houses and rubbish )freezing (heater works only couple hours at night),I'm supposed to stay for 5nights but I only stayed for one day and half and payed them for 2nights ,then changed the hotel ,how sad is that looking for hotel while I'm in holiday,was just waste of money and time

title: hotel
review: This was a real find!  Close to all the main atrtactions of Old Istanbul, 5 minute walk to Topkapi Palace, 10 minutes to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. 2 minute walk from main train station, port and tram stop. Couldn't be better positioned.  Rooms clean and comfortable - not spacioius but perfect for city break as we didn't spend any time in the room.  Breakfast was a real treat - sitting on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorous and the commings and goings of the busy port.  And after a hard day sight seeing, what better way to finish off than by sitting on the roof terrace and watch the beautiful lights of a fabulous city.  Really helpful staff. Thank you for a great stay!!

title: Good place, good service, bad everything else
review: Excellent location, but rooms very small and bathrooms rather basic.  Staff friendly, so as long as you get a good deal and value for money, it will be OK.. good breakfast.  we stayed in one side of the hotel, but I think the side where the breakfast room is, will be much better  The hotel has 4 flights and no lift!

title: not adviseble to anyone
review: The good: - The staff is nice and help you as they can, providing you with some famous turkish hospitality; - It's located near lots of restaurants, shops, and the Sirkeci tram station. You can also easily walk to some touristic locations like Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkaki Palace, etc; - Fast enough wifi internet connection;  The bad: - Really small room; - Bed surrounded by walls on 3 sides; - Sometimes the maid would not leave clean towels or other stuff; - 500 TV channels yet none worth watching; - Room was old and had very cheap decoration, including a hologram photo; - Shower didn't have curtains or anything separating it from the rest of the bathroom, even the floor is the same, so whenever you shower everything in the bathroom gets wet; - Though the…

title: Centrally located with friendly staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great value for the money
review: The hotel is located in Sirkeci, very close to the Orient Express train station. There is a view of the Bosphorus from the terrace of the property. The location is ideal for sightseeing and exploring the historical centre of Istanbul. The staff was always very helpful and provided us with much useful information and advice. As far as the room is concerned, it was rather small. There was also an ensuite bathroom which was really tiny. The breakfast served on the roof terrace consisted of Turkish breakfast with a reasonable selection of hot and cold beverages. All in all, I can only recommend the property to those looking for a fairly priced accommodation in the centre of Istanbul.

title: Old room
review: The hotel isn't perfect, but you get at least 100% of what you could expect for the price you pay.  Location: Excellent. Close to the tramway, railway station, ferries and boats. Walking distance or short tramway trip to all the main attractions. Room: Small. Working air conditioning, thank god!  Bathroom: Small, with quite a primitive shower (you have to sit on or stand next to the toilet seat when showering).  Cleaning: Far from painstaking, but satisfactory. Noise: Ear plugs are recommended. The first call for prayer is around 5 AM, and its sound is NOT stopped by the walls... Additionally, the cleaning staff can be rather noisy if you want to take a nap in the afternoon. The street in itself is rather quiet, though. Breakfast: Great!! Lots to choose from - bread, butter,…

title: An excellent hotel with excellent staff
review: We booked via booking.com looking at the pictures which were good. When we got there we were given something very different.   The room was on the 4th floor with no lift. Walking up and down with luggage is no joke.   The room looked very old and the bathroom was terrible. Even the beds and sheets were old worn out.  The following morning we realised this hotel had two buildings side by side. We  were given a room in the old one while the pictures showed on booking.com belong to the rooms in the new part of the building.   Dont be tricked and always ask for the new part of the building as we felt cheated paying the price we did when we were offered something else other then what was advertised on booking.com  It seemed as if we were given the worst room just because we had…

title: fair hotel
review: Before i arrived to the hotel eith my family,we were thinking to change it,but we were lucky that we didnt find another one,because after our residence in hurriyet hotel,we could see how the location of it was excellent and the staff are very helpful and smiling all the time,rooms are very clean with A/C and TV, and some of them have bubble basin,at ladt i want to say that i will never hesitate to come back to this hotel if i come to istanbul again.

title: Very good hotel...
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great time in Istanbul
review: Hurriyet hotel is very close to all tourists attractions,close to sirkeci tram station....The staff was very friendly and the rooms very clean...the only disadvantage is that they dont have mini fridge to put something.for its price i think is the best choice...

title: Good location, clean and friendly
review: Great location, staff were very friendly and polite answering on all our guestions giving us good advices. Room was cleaning every day.

title: This is Turkey, for middle level Europe
review: Just spent three nights at the Hurriyet Hotel - the location is very good for a short sight seeing stay - close to ferries, walking distance to Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Sultanahmi Mosque.  Clean double room and good bathroom facilities with lift to second and above floors. Good value for money bed and breakfast: breakfast on the roof terrace has a view over the Bosphorus.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Seems a bit expensive compared to recent travels elsewhere.

title: No customer service and staff with attitude... Don't go there!!
review: Last year I have been in Istanbul and I stayed in this hotel with 2 persons. This was my second visit to Istanbul. We stayed there 5 days (6 nights). We got a small room with 3 bed. It was on 2 rd floor, there was no elevator in this part of building. The room had air condition, but toilet was small and typical turkish - it didnt have separate part for shower but its all together.  The stuff was ignorant, and  abnoxious. I was there with turkish guy, so he negotiate with them instead of me.   The breakfast was good and surpisingly all was fresh and many kinds of meals.  The best trait of this hotel was location - if you are coming to Istanbul for the first time, it has great place for the most important turistical spots - all is near, traffic, Yerabatan Sarnici, Aya Sofia, BLue…

title: excellent value for money
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best in its class
review: we stayed in the hotel for 3 nights - friendly staff, nice breakfast,convenient location,close to tram and all major attractions(walking distance),although rooms are small it is clean, nice and comfortable, new bathrooms,all this for much cheaper than other  accommodations available - 40 euro's per night.

title: Perfect location, great staff!
review: Pros: -More than friendly stuff, they are helping you sincerely; they act with me as a touristic guide as well on all my questions and destinations in Istanbul for free. -Great location; medium point between the sea central port (eminonu), the tram station (Sirkeci), and the historical attractions in the old city (sultanahmet), you could go all on foot -Always clean rooms, no smells -Room is packed with most of utilities although it is small   Cons: -Small sized room, you should be slim to fit in it, but i think you would not stay at the room of any hotel in istanbul more than sleeping time, you have much to see outside the hotel. -Internet isn’t reliable except in the lobby. -Breakfast is very basic and repetitive (egg, cheese, cake, etc)  Take care, taxi driver may refuse to…

title: Awful rooms in a great location
review: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for two weeks and absolutely loved it. The staff was so nice and kind to us and always wanted to help as much as they could and we will forever be grateful to them. It's  a hotel I strongly recommend and I hope that everyone will enjoy their stay as much as we did. It was so close to all the historical sights and everything you possibly could want to see. It felt like home and we are already thinking about going back some time soon and enjoy Istanbul all over again. You won't be dissapointed! Hurriyet Hotel and Istanbul...See you soon!!!

title: The place you would like to return
review: We chose Hurriyet based on the location and that did not disappoint us. It is located in a perfect base to cover all the major attractions in the center of Istanbul. The Galata bridge to the blue mosque and Hagia Sophia fall within a 10-20 minutes walking radius, you also get a tram stop very close by. Despite this, the hotel is located in a small alley, which is quiet relatively speaking, allowing you to have some decent sleep ( if you could manage to decently sleep in the room provided, that is).  They serve a fantastic breakfast, one of the best we have had in our 8 days visit of different parts of Turkey.  Now the negatives. The room we got was awful. It was extremely cramped, and stuffy, with flimsy and creaking furniture. Everything was bare minimal, not even a blanket was…

title: Cheap and nice
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great Stay in Offseason
review: For a first time traveler to Istanbul, I had heard so much about the Turkish hospitality that I was prepared to be charmed. And charmed I was at the Hurriyet hotel. I booked into this hotel for a conference and was on an extremely tight budget. So in a sense I got what I paid for. The first room that was shown to me was through a winding staircase right on the top floor of the hotel that might have made me feel like a maiden in a tower. But I coyly declined seeing the miniscule bathroom. I mean it was tiny. Imagine a toilet on top of which was a showerhead and you will know what I mean! So they managed to find another room, in which the bathroom was slightly larger. The rooms in this hotel are small, but its a nice neighbourhood and the best part is that its so close to all the…

title: Small dirty hotel close to Eminoni.
review: I traveled to Istanbul in January of 2011.  First, we were staying at the Sirma Sultan Hotel, which was perhaps the worst hotel experience I've ever had.  After many a sleepless twilight, we found Hotel Hurriyet on Booking.com, and thus we decided to move hotels.    We stayed for five or six nights, all of which were extremely pleasant.  The room was the perfect size for two young travelers.  We spent most of the days doing various things in Istanbul, but always returned fairly early in the evening for rest and relaxation.  The room was quiet, the staff was excessively friendly, and the breakfast was always ready by the time we woke in the morning (usually around 8).    The manager was extremely friendly with us, never hesitating to offer advice or directions as to how we could…

title: disspointed
review: Small and dirty rooms! £40 for a night, this is robbery for this quality. But close to Eminoni. Not recomending!

title: Not Bad, but not good either
review: customer service is not available in this hotel, no toilet paper, and hard towels, some with holes, the toilet/shower is terrible, an all in one , with no curtain, cannot have a shave in the hand basin which is small and have no hot water, the toilet seat was broken, The breakfast was terrible, at times there was no napkins, pepper or friut juice, and never appear fresh. Cups and plates from the breakfast was rince off in a hand basin. we was really disppointed but very good for sightseeing .

title: Very Good Hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: very welcoming and helpful staff
review: Very good hotel. We stayed for three days and we were very satisfied. The service was very good. it has clean, quiet and warm rooms and good bathroom. It also included good breakfast.   For its price it is perfect!

title: Dirty rooms, rude staff
review: the staff was welcoming and friendly. they made us feel comfortable and tried to ensre all our needs were met and questions were answered to the best they could. the hotel was clean. the lounge was trendy and renovated. the breakfast room was nice. we ejnjoyed our stay very much!
